DataElement.preferredDefinition: An indication additional categories for seriousness apply.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Adverse Event Adverse Event Associated with Serious Medical Event
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s)._An indication or description of an adverse event associated with a critical medical event.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An unwanted effect caused by a drug or therapy.  Such effects can be drug related, dose related, route related, patient related, caused by an interaction with another drug, or caused by opioid initiation or dose escalation.

Concepts.definition: Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).

ObjectClass.changeDescription: Change concept code to C41331 as C2861 is retired per EVS. dw

ReferenceDocuments.name: Was the adverse event a medic
ReferenceDocuments.description: Was the adverse event a medically important event not covered by other serious criteria?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Case Report Form Completion Instructions
ReferenceDocuments.description: Record whether the serious adverse event is an important medical event, which may be defined in the protocol or in the Investigator Brochure.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CDASH Implementation Notes
ReferenceDocuments.description: If the details regarding Serious AEs are collected in the clinical database, then it is recommended that a separate Yes/No variable be defined for each Serious AE type. Sponsors may only collect the AESER field because the individual serious adverse event types might be collected in a separate pharmacovigilance database and therefore are not collected in the clinical database. The sponsor should check if the regulatory agencies to which the data will be submitted require the collection of this data.

ReferenceDocuments.name: AESMIE
ReferenceDocuments.description: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable.

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 100
ReferenceDocuments.description: Was the adverse event considered to be an "other" important medical event that may jeopardize the patient and may require medical or surgical intervention to prevent death, hospitalization, or a threat to life?

ReferenceDocuments.description: Did the adverse event result in: Other?
